description:
The `appId`, `contextId`, and `resourceId` are all required and associate the created comment with the specific
resource it responds to. See [Integrations](#introduction) for a list of integrated scopes for these fields.

If the created comment is a direct response to another comment, the `commentId` of the parent comment should be passed
as `parentComment.id` in this comment's request. See [Terminology](#introduction) for additional information on parent comments and replies.

docs.summary: Return thread of a comment or reply
description:
If comment thread requested, the API will return a single comment along with cursors that can be utilized with the
ListCommentsByResource API to load previous and subsequent comment pages.

In case reply thread requested, the API will return the root parent comment, the reply itself, and cursors that
can be utilized with the ListCommentsByResource API to load previous and subsequent pages of comments or replies.

description:
API designed to load comments and replies. It return only published comments and replies.
Hidden or Deleted comment or reply are not returned unless they have more than one published reply.

params.name: commentId
params.doc: ID of the comment to moderate.

params.name: revision
params.doc:
Revision number, which increments by `1` each time the comment is updated.

To prevent conflicting changes, the current `revision` must be passed when updating the comment.

docs.summary: Moderates the draft content of a comment.
description:
- `APPROVE`: Moves `draftContent` to `content` and updates the comment `status` to `PUBLISHED`.
- `REJECT`: Clears `draftContent` if comment `status` is `PUBLISHED` or, if comment `status` is `PENDING` it will keep `draftContent` the same and change `status` to `HIDDEN`.

examples.title: moderateDraftContent example for dashboard page code
body: const result = await comments.moderateDraftContent(commentId, revision, options);

examples.title: moderateDraftContent example for exporting from backend code
body: const result = await elevatedModerateDraftContent(commentId, revision, options);

params.name: appId
params.doc: App ID to query comments for.

docs.summary: Creates a query to retrieve a list of comments.
description: The `queryComments()` function builds a query to retrieve a list of comments and returns a [`CommentsQueryBuilder`](#commentsquerybuilder) object.
The returned object contains the query definition, which is typically used to run the query using the [`find()`](#commentsquerybuilder/find) function.

You can refine the query by chaining `CommentsQueryBuilder` functions onto the query. `CommentsQueryBuilder` functions enable you to sort, filter, and control the results that `queryComments()` returns.
`queryComments()` runs with the following `CommentsQueryBuilder` default that you can override:

The functions that are chained to `queryComments()` are applied in the order they are called. For example, if you apply `ascending("voteSummary.netVoteCount")` and then `ascending("replyCount")`, the results are sorted first by the `"voteSummary.netVoteCount"`, and then, if there are multiple results with the same `"voteSummary.netVoteCount"`, the items are sorted by `"replyCount"`.

The following `CommentsQueryBuilder` functions are supported for the `queryComments()` function. For a full description of the comment object, see the object returned for the [`items`](#commentsqueryresult/items) property in [`CommentsQueryResult`](#commentsqueryresult).

examples.title: queryComments example for dashboard page code
queryComments example for exporting from backend code

description:
Each time the comment is updated, `revision` increments by 1. The current `revision` must be
passed when updating the comment. This ensures you're working with the latest comment and
prevents unintended overwrites.

members.name: _createdDate
members.doc: Date and time the comment was created.

members.doc: Date and time the comment was last updated.

members.name: appId
members.doc: ID of the app that the comment is added to.

members.name: commentDate
members.doc: Indicates the initial creation date of the comment, useful when importing comments

members.name: contentEdited
members.doc: Whether the comment has edited content

members.name: contextId
members.doc:
ID of the specific context the comment is in response to.

Within some Wix apps, the `contextId` will be the same as the `resourceId`. For example in Wix Forum,
the `forumPostId` is used as both the `contextId` and the `resourceId`.

members.name: parentComment
members.doc:
Parent comment information.

See [Terminology](#introduction) for more information about parent comments.

members.name: replyCount
members.doc: Amount of comments that reply to this comment.

members.name: resourceId
members.doc:
ID of the specific resource that the comment is in response to.

Within some Wix apps, the `resourceId` will be the same as the `contextId`. For example in Wix Forum,
the `forumPostId` is used as both the `resourceId` and the `contextId`.

members.name: revision
members.doc:
Revision number, which increments by 1 each time the comment is updated.

To prevent conflicting changes, the current `revision` must be passed when updating the comment.

members.name: status
members.doc:
Comment status.

Supported values:
+ `"PUBLISHED"`: This comment is published and publicly visible.
+ `"DELETED"`: This comment is deleted.
+ `"PENDING"`: This comment is pending moderation. Moderation is not currently supported.
+ `"HIDDEN"`: This comment has been hidden by a site moderator.

description:
A comment is a user-generated message in response to a specific resource. It allows site visitors
to share feedback or engage in discussions around different types of resources, including blog posts, forum threads,
or other site content. Comments are composed of text, images, videos, or other forms of media.

members.name: memberId
members.doc: Member ID. See the Members API for more details.

members.name: memberId
members.doc: Member ID. See the Members API for more details.

members.name: mentions
members.doc:
Mentions to tag with this comment.

Mentions can include users, members, visitors, or groups.

members.name: reactionCodeCount
members.doc:
Amounts of each type of reaction. `"key"` is the code for a reaction type and
`"value"` is the amount of that reaction type.

members.name: keepMarkedInOriginalOrder
members.doc:
If set to `true`, marked comments are included in the comments list but maintain their original order rather
than being moved to the top.
Defaults to `false`, which means marked comments, will be prioritized and listed first.

members.name: memberId
members.doc:
Member ID. See the [Members API](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/members/members/member-object)
for more details.

members.name: memberId
members.doc:
Member ID. See the [Members API](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/members/members/member-object)
for more details.

members.name: appId
members.doc: App ID to count the comments of.

members.name: cursor
members.doc:
Pointer to the next or previous page in the list of results.

Pass the relevant cursor token from the `pagingMetadata` object in the previous call's response.
Not relevant for the first request.

members.name: limit
members.doc: Maximum number of items to return in the results.

members.name: count
members.doc: Number of items returned in the response.

members.name: cursors
members.doc: Cursor strings that point to the next page, previous page, or both.

members.name: hasNext
members.doc:
Whether there are more pages to retrieve following the current page.

+ `true`: Another page of results can be retrieved.
+ `false`: This is the last page.

members.name: cursorPaging
members.doc: Cursor token pointing to a page of results. Not used in the first request. Following requests use the cursor token and not `filter` or `sort`.

members.name: filter
sort
members.doc:
Sort object in the following format:
`[{"fieldName":"sortField1","order":"ASC"},{"fieldName":"sortField2","order":"DESC"}]`

members.name: cursorPaging
members.doc: Cursor token pointing to a page of results. Not used in the first request. Following requests use the cursor token and not `filter` or `sort`.

members.name: next
members.doc: Cursor string pointing to the next page in the list of results.

members.name: prev
members.doc: Cursor pointing to the previous page in the list of results.

members.name: _id
members.doc:
Unique event ID.
Allows clients to ignore duplicate webhooks.

members.name: entityEventSequence
members.doc:
A sequence number defining the order of updates to the underlying entity.
For example, given that some entity was updated at 16:00 and than again at 16:01,
it is guaranteed that the sequence number of the second update is strictly higher than the first.
As the consumer, you can use this value to ensure that you handle messages in the correct order.
To do so, you will need to persist this number on your end, and compare the sequence number from the
message against the one you have stored. Given that the stored number is higher, you should ignore the message.

members.name: entityFqdn
members.doc:
Assumes actions are also always typed to an entity_type
Example: wix.stores.catalog.product, wix.bookings.session, wix.payments.transaction

members.name: entityId
members.doc: ID of the entity associated with the event.

members.name: originatedFrom
members.doc: If present, indicates the action that triggered the event.

members.name: slug
members.doc:
This is top level to ease client code dispatching of messages (switch on entity_fqdn+slug)
This is although the created/updated/deleted notion is duplication of the oneof types
Example: created/updated/deleted/started/completed/email_opened

members.name: triggeredByAnonymizeRequest
members.doc:
Whether the event was triggered as a result of a privacy regulation application
(for example, GDPR).

members.name: containerData
members.doc: Styling for the oEmbed node's container.

members.name: currentEntityAsJson
members.doc:
Since platformized APIs only expose PATCH and not PUT we can't assume that the fields sent from the client are the actual diff.
This means that to generate a list of changed fields (as opposed to sent fields) one needs to traverse both objects.
We don't want to impose this on all developers and so we leave this traversal to the notification recipients which need it.

members.name: rel
members.doc: The HTML `rel` attribute value for the link. This object specifies the relationship between the current document and the linked document.

members.name: target
members.doc:
he HTML `target` attribute value for the link. This property defines where the linked document opens as follows:
`SELF` - Default. Opens the linked document in the same frame as the link.
`BLANK` - Opens the linked document in a new browser tab or window.
`PARENT` - Opens the linked document in the link's parent frame.
`TOP` - Opens the linked document in the full body of the link's browser tab or window.

PDF view mode. One of the following:
`NONE` : The PDF isn't displayed.
`FULL` : A full page view of the PDF is displayed.
`MINI` : A mini view of the PDF is displayed.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Comment ID of the parent comment.

members.name: allowMultipleVotes
members.doc: Sets whether one voter can vote multiple times. Defaults to `false`.

members.name: view
members.doc: Sets who can view the poll results.

members.name: autoPlay
members.doc: Sets whether the media will automatically start playing.

members.name: playInLoop
members.doc: Sets whether media's will be looped.

members.name: showControls
members.doc: Sets whether media's controls will be shown.

members.name: alignment
members.doc: The node's alignment within its container.

members.name: height
members.doc: The height of the node when it's displayed.

members.name: spoiler
members.doc: Spoiler cover settings for the node.

members.name: textWrap
members.doc: Sets whether text should wrap around this node when it's displayed. If `textWrap` is `false`, the node takes up the width of its container. Defaults to `true` for all node types except 'DIVIVDER' where it defaults to `false`.

members.name: width
members.doc: The width of the node when it's displayed.

members.name: custom
members.doc: A custom width value in pixels.

members.name: size
members.doc:
One of the following predefined width options:
`CONTENT`: The width of the container matches the content width.
`SMALL`: A small width.
`ORIGINAL`: For `imageData` containers only. The width of the container matches the original image width.
`FULL_WIDTH`: For `imageData` containers only. The image container takes up the full width of the screen.

members.name: custom
members.doc: A custom width value in pixels.

members.name: size
members.doc:
One of the following predefined width options:
`CONTENT`: The width of the container matches the content width.
`SMALL`: A small width.
`ORIGINAL`: For `imageData` containers only. The width of the container matches the original image width.
`FULL_WIDTH`: For `imageData` containers only. The image container takes up the full width of the screen.

members.name: settings
members.doc: The poll's permissions and display settings.

members.name: design
members.doc: Styling for the poll and voting options.

members.name: layout
members.doc: Layout settings for the poll and voting options.

members.name: direction
members.doc: The direction of the text displayed in the voting options. Text can be displayed either right-to-left or left-to-right.

members.name: enableImage
members.doc: Sets whether to display the main poll image. Defaults to `false`.

members.name: type
members.doc: The layout for displaying the voting options.

members.name: commentId
members.doc: ID of the comment to publish.

members.name: appId
members.doc: App ID to query comments for.

members.name: nofollow
members.doc: Indicates to search engine crawlers not to follow the link. Defaults to `false`.

members.name: noreferrer
members.doc: Indicates that this link protect referral information from being passed to the target website.

members.name: sponsored
members.doc: Indicates to search engine crawlers that the link is a paid placement such as sponsored content or an advertisement. Defaults to `false`.

members.name: ugc
members.doc: Indicates that this link is user-generated content and isn't necessarily trusted or endorsed by the pages author. For example, a link in a fourm post. Defaults to `false`.

members.name: keepMarkedInOriginalOrder
members.doc:
If set to `true`, marked replies are included in the comments list but maintain their original order rather
than being moved to the top.
Defaults to `false`, which means marked replies, will be prioritized and listed first.

members.name: documentStyle
members.doc: Global styling for header, paragraph, block quote, and code block nodes in the object.

members.name: nodes
members.doc: Node objects representing a rich content document.

members.name: showVoters
members.doc: Sets whether voters are displayed in the vote results. Defaults to `true`.

members.name: showVotesCount
members.doc: Sets whether the vote count is displayed. Defaults to `true`.

members.name: fieldName
members.doc: Name of the field to sort by.

members.name: buttonText
members.doc: The text for the button used to remove the spoiler cover.

members.name: description
members.doc: The description displayed on top of the spoiler cover.

members.name: enabled
members.doc: Sets whether the spoiler cover is enabled for this node. Defaults to `false`.

members.name: cellStyle
members.doc: Styling for the cell's background color and text alignment.

members.name: columnHeader
members.doc: Sets whether the table's first column is a header. Defaults to `false`.

members.name: rowHeader
members.doc: Sets whether the table's first row is a header. Defaults to `false`.

members.name: text
members.doc: The text to apply decorations to.

members.name: decorations
members.doc: The decorations to apply to the node.

members.name: lineHeight
members.doc: Line height for text in the node.

members.name: nodeStyle
members.doc: Padding and background color for the node.

members.name: lineHeight
members.doc: A CSS `line-height` value for the text expressed as a ratio relative to the font size. For example, if the font size is 20px, a `lineHeight` value of `'1.5'`` results in a line height of 30px.

members.name: commentId
members.doc: ID of the comment to unmark.

members.name: _createdDate
members.doc: Date and time the comment was created.

members.name: _updatedDate
members.doc: Date and time the comment was last updated.

members.name: appId
members.doc: ID of the app that the comment is added to.

members.name: commentDate
members.doc: Indicates the initial creation date of the comment, useful when importing comments

members.name: contentEdited
members.doc: Whether the comment has edited content

members.name: contextId
members.doc:
ID of the specific context the comment is in response to.

Within some Wix apps, the `contextId` will be the same as the `resourceId`. For example in Wix Forum,
the `forumPostId` is used as both the `contextId` and the `resourceId`.

members.name: parentComment
members.doc:
Parent comment information.

See [Terminology](#introduction) for more information about parent comments.

members.name: replyCount
members.doc: Amount of comments that reply to this comment.

members.name: resourceId
members.doc:
ID of the specific resource that the comment is in response to.

Within some Wix apps, the `resourceId` will be the same as the `contextId`. For example in Wix Forum,
the `forumPostId` is used as both the `resourceId` and the `contextId`.

members.name: revision
members.doc:
Revision number, which increments by 1 each time the comment is updated.

To prevent conflicting changes, the current `revision` must be passed when updating the comment.

members.name: status
members.doc:
Comment status.

Supported values:
+ `"PUBLISHED"`: This comment is published and publicly visible.
+ `"DELETED"`: This comment is deleted.
+ `"PENDING"`: This comment is pending moderation. Moderation is not currently supported.
+ `"HIDDEN"`: This comment has been hidden by a site moderator.

members.name: correlationId
members.doc: id to pass to processing notification

members.name: removeDocumentIds
members.doc: one or more ids of indexed documents to be removed. Removal will happen before addition (if both provided)

members.name: versionedDeleteByIds
members.doc: delete by document ids with versioning

members.name: versionedDeleteByIds
members.doc: delete by document ids with versioning

members.name: documentIds
members.doc: ids with version of the documents to delete

members.name: versioningMode
members.doc: versioning mode to use instead of default

members.name: versioningMode
members.doc: versioning mode to use instead of default

members.name: disableDownload
members.doc: Sets whether the video's download button is disabled. Defaults to `false`.

members.name: assetKey
members.doc:
Key to identify the video resolution's relationship to the original media in WixMedia.
Can be used to request a download for the specific video resolution.
For example: 480p.mp4, 720p.mp4, 1080p.mp4, trailer-720p.mp4, clip-720p.mp4

members.name: format
members.doc: Video format for example, mp4, hls.

members.name: private
members.doc:
When true, this is a protected asset, and calling the URL will return a 403 error.
In order to access private assets, make a request to:
`GenerateFileDownloadUrl` with the WixMedia id and specify the asset_key in the request

members.name: downvoteCount
members.doc: Amount of downvotes on this comment.

members.name: netVoteCount
members.doc: Amount of upvotes less downvotes on this comment.

members.name: upvoteCount
members.doc: Amount of upvotes on this comment.
